name: ticklishly
content:
ticklishly adverb
(CAUSING DISCOMFORT)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that touches your skin lightly and makes you feel uncomfortable: The liquid began to run ticklishly along my nose. A butterfly brushed ticklishly against her skin.
More examplesFewer examplesThe blood flowed ticklishly down his finger.I could feel a ticklishly cool breeze on my face. Her hair was ticklishly close to my cheek.

ticklishly adverb
(CAUSING LAUGHTER)
in a way that makes you laugh: She puts in a ticklishly appealing performance as the children's grandmother. He made his name as a writer of ticklishly amusing satires.

ticklishly adverb
(NEEDING CARE)
in a way that forces you to act very carefully: Maintaining public services while running a free-market economy has proved to be a ticklishly difficult combination. Rather ticklishly, she had to persuade the backers to put their trust in an inexperienced director and cast.
